alert.note: Alert for Grand Forks (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 12:09PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Polk, Grand Forks, Walsh and Marshall Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Cass and Richland Counties. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. Maple River near Enderlin affecting Cass and Ransom Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at East Grand Forks. * WHEN...From late Monday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Extensive flooding along the greenway. (Grand Forks) Point Bridge closes due to water on approach and Eagles Point Trail Head/Park closes. (East Grand Forks) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue rising to 39.2 feet Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
